intro: Hypochaeris nahuelvutae, commonly known as the Nahuelhuapi buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, adapting to temperate climates. It has small, hairy leaves and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
